trans-unit.source: Contains a set of attributes associated with a particular <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement.SamlSubject"></xref>.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement> class corresponds to the `<saml:AttributeStatement>` XML element that is defined in the OASIS SAML 1.1 specification.
The claims for SamlSecurityToken security tokens are contained in SAML statements, which are in turn contained within a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAssertion>.
One such statement is the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement>, which binds a set of arbitrary claims to a particular <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject>.
The claims are represented as a collection of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> and are stored in the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.Attributes%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement"></xref> class using the specified subject and set of attributes associated with the subject.
The following table specifies the properties set by the parameters to this constructor.
Property
Parameter
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubject"></xref> that specifies the subject of the claim.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains a set of attributes associated with the subject.
samlSubject is `null`.
attributes contains a member that is `null`.
-or-
attributes contains zero members.
Adds the specified set of claims as attributes to this SAML statement.

Use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.AddClaimsToList%28System.Collections.Generic.IList%7BSystem.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim%7D%29> method to convert a set of claims into attributes of a SAML assertion.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Claims.Claim"></xref> that contains the set of claims to add to the SAML statement.
Gets a collection of attributes associated with the subject of the SAML assertion.
Each <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute> may contain multiple attribute values.

Each member of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.Attributes%2A> collection corresponds to the `<saml:Attribute>` element that is defined in the Assertions and Protocol for the OASIS SAML specification.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Generic.IList`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttribute"></xref> that contains a set of attributes associated with the subject.
Gets a value indicating whether the properties of this instance are read-only.
To make this instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement> class read-only, call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method.
`true` if the properties of this instance are read-only; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Causes this instance to be read-only.

When the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.MakeReadOnly%2A> method is called, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.IsReadOnly%2A> property is set to `true` and properties of this instance can no longer be set.
Reads the SAML attribute statement from the specified XML reader.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.ReadXml%28System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenSerializer%2CSystem.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver%29> method sets the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlAttributeStatement.Attributes%2A> and <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSubjectStatement.SamlSubject%2A> properties.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryReader"></xref> to read the SAML attribute statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of reading XML elements in the SAML attribute statement that is defined in the SAML specification.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Selectors.SecurityTokenResolver"></xref> that determines the security token that created the digital signature.
reader is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`
reader refers to an XML element that does not contain a `` element
-or-
reader refers to an XML element that contains a `` element that does not have an attribute value.
Writes the SAML attribute statement into the specified XML serializer.
An <xref href="System.Xml.XmlDictionaryWriter"></xref> to write the SAML attribute statement.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SamlSerializer"></xref> that is capable of writing XML elements in a SAML assertion.
writer is `null`
-or-
samlSerializer is `null`
